channel.title: OutOfMemoryError : Java Heap Space
channel.description:
This error just randomly pops up when I go to run my cache editor. I couldn't comprehend most of the help I found on Google.
I've tried this but it came to the same error. [code] @echo off java -Xmx2048M -cp bin alex.Main pause[/code]
Could someone help me with this? Is there a way to clear my garbage collector?

item.title: OutOfMemoryError : Java Heap Space
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:21, topic:508595”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=626834.msg4261821#msg4261821 date=1363541674]

Could I somehow just remove all of the garbage? It works fine on other computers.

If that is the case, then how much RAM does the computer it doesn’t work on have? Have you tried copying the cache giving you the problem so you have an exact copy on the other computer?
[/quote]

This is a 4G ram and the other is a 6G[/quote]
Try putting the cache giving you the issue on a pendrive and open it on the other computer. If it works then I’m not sure. You just have to make sure its not a corrupt copy and not your comp.

Read full topic

[/quote]
If that is the case, then how much RAM does the computer it doesn’t work on have? Have you tried copying the cache giving you the problem so you have an exact copy on the other computer?[/quote]

This is a 4G ram and the other is a 6G

item.title: OutOfMemoryError : Java Heap Space
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Hash1, post:16, topic:508595”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=626834.msg4261516#msg4261516 date=1363500197]

lower your xmx arguments. the jvm is allocating too much heap space.

That makes no sense…
[/quote]

Yes it does, the JVM has a limit to the space it can allocate.[/quote]
2048MB is far from that limit. The tekkit minecraft server default is 4GB and it does use it. Besides, he’s having an outofmemory due to not enough, not because it couldn’t allocate.

Read full topic

item.title: OutOfMemoryError : Java Heap Space
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:13, topic:508595”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=626834.msg4261490#msg4261490 date=1363499457]
lower your xmx arguments. the jvm is allocating too much heap space.
[/quote]
That makes no sense…[/quote]

Yes it does, the JVM has a limit to the space it can allocate.

Read full topic

item.title: OutOfMemoryError : Java Heap Space
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:14, topic:508595”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=626834.msg4261469#msg4261469 date=1363497707]

Does the cache editor actually decode any models, like to draw them in the editor? Or does it just give you a big list of them all with buttons to add/delete them.

I only use it to pack other cache indexes into my cache. I believe it just replaces the files.
[/quote]
What is the number of models in the cache? Does it always happen when you edit index 17? Does it happen with other indices?

The only other option besides corruption would be the program is poorly designed and is using up way too much memory[/quote]

I’ve been editing with this for a while now. This problem just started happening.

Read full topic

item.title: OutOfMemoryError : Java Heap Space
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:12, topic:508595”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=626834.msg4261468#msg4261468 date=1363497619]
Does the cache editor actually decode any models, like to draw them in the editor? Or does it just give you a big list of them all with buttons to add/delete them.
[/quote]

I only use it to pack other cache indexes into my cache. I believe it just replaces the files.[/quote]
What is the number of models in the cache? Does it always happen when you edit index 17? Does it happen with other indices?

The only other option besides corruption would be the program is poorly designed and is using up way too much memory

Read full topic

item.title: OutOfMemoryError : Java Heap Space
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:4, topic:508595”]I’ve tried using the Xms argument and increasing the xmx size but it didn’t work.

What would cause a memory leak?[/quote]
It’s impossible to say without looking at some code.

Read full topic

item.title: OutOfMemoryError : Java Heap Space
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

I’ve tried using the Xms argument and increasing the xmx size but it didn’t work.

What would cause a memory leak?

Read full topic

item.title: OutOfMemoryError : Java Heap Space
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

The application you’re using may have a memory leak. Have you tried using a different garbage collector? Supposedly, the parallel garbage collector works better on applications that hog memory.

You could also try setting the initial JVM heap size by using the Xms argument, in the same way you’re using Xmx.

Read full topic

item.title: OutOfMemoryError : Java Heap Space
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

My first idea would be to increase the -Xmx2048M to something higher.

Read full topic
